title: Anyone else sick of this spoiled brat?
body:
{{champion:157}} 
He is the definition of a spoiled brat. He is a pain to play against as well as to play with. He can hold his q for 10 seconds zoning me from cs, his windwall is still irritating, and his playerbase are notorius for toxicity. He demands all the jungler attention so he can get fed.

replies.body:
I usually ban him because he's got the Shaco syndrome. 


Enemy Yasuo is a god, while your Yasuo averages 9 Deaths a game.
Yours only has nine... Lucky bastard.

was hoping for forum drama 

disappoint
Is it bad that I saw this thread title, thought the exact same thing, and had like four candidates in mind before I even opened the thread?

WHERE DID THIS COME FROM? I mean i know people still dont like him but for real?

Are you upvote farming, are upset you just either met a toxic Yas, or fed a good Yas.

Most of the time it is one on the poster's team who fed their ass off and flamed the rest of the team for it.

I'd rather have yasuos do good on the other team than have a useless one on mine.
I mean he is so meh right now. This post just feels like needless complaining.
the OP wasnt complaining about yasuo being op, he was complaining about how annoying it is to play in a game with a yasuo.

Hes arguing slightly on balance things that while annoying he is so meh right now it doesnt really matter.

And on the player part, ANNOYING PLAYERS ARE ANNOYING. Yasuo and Riven players get more flak for playing that champion, but i have seen many players everywhere else. And when you see them you just "this ADC is annoying," but if its Yas its "Yas players are annoying"

No matter what i view this thread as needless complaining

NA Boards.

Yasuo circlejerk is very popular here.

Go play on Korean Server (Which consists of the most skilled players) so you could adapt to better players. If you can't play around Yasuo, Doubt you can play around Annie.

Yasuo isn't strong in this Meta at all.

I shall await for those salty actual *Spoiled* *Br@ts* to down vote me since I have said the harsh truth about how you people who can't play around Yasuo have *''Zero''* patience & awareness of his kit. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

>Go play on Korean Server

Good idea, do you have a Korean SSN laying around that I can use?
You uh..you dont seem like a spoiled brat at all yourself here do ya bud :>
How so?

I mean you came onto here just to bash NA for talking about Yasuo. You wanted to start an argument which is a little bratty in my opinion that you would want people to argue with also I see you telling people to go to the Korean server which yeah they are the best player base but you dont need to come on here and be a prick to people.

First of all, I did not *''BASH"* NA for *''Talking''* about Yasuo.

This is what I have said and meant as well: ''Yasuo circlejerk is very popular here'' Yeah, I am totally *''Bashing''* The whole NA server by saying that sentence.

>You wanted to start an argument which is a little bratty in my opinion.

No I did not want to start an argument with anyone, I simply desire for those who complain about Yasuo to keep playing, Adapt & learn to play around Yasuo & his kit instead of wasting their precious cinnamon time complaining on the boards that won't make a difference.

Yes, Korean server are indeed the best player base.


>You don't need to come on here and be a prick to people.

Because I have offended those people whom refuse to learn to play around Yasuo and are lazy that fail to realize that Yasuo isn't even strong. TL;DR *''Being a prick by saying the harsh truth about how people refuse to learn to play around Yasuo & his kit.'' Kappa

No the way you decided to say these things and in the way that you said it is being a prick. Simply the way you stated everything was all to insult people you could have said all these things without implicating "ah NA boards yasuo circle jerk" that was uncalled for completely. You do know there are ways to convey your opinions without being snobbish about it right?

Well excuse me for being a bit too blunt I suppose. I am sorry to those whom I have offended by being way too *blunt* and using the wrong use of words, Like you & Skorch have stated, I just said it the worst possible way.
I understand what hes getting at. He just said it the WORSE way possible.

Playing against him isn't the main issue.

Having one on your team is.
Practice makes perfect.

Practice having a bad Yasuo on your team?
How do you practice that? Seeing how hard you can carry them?
You misunderstood, I meant the only way this ''Yasuo'' player on your team can get good at not feed as the Yasuo Circlejerk threads are about is by keep playing Yasuo and keep practicing.
You misunderstood, What I meant was that the only way this certain ''Yasuo'' Player on your team like the circlejerk threads on NA claim CAN IMPROVE is by playing Yasuo & keep practicing.
Then practice in normals?
Duh or Use practice mode.
So then why let him in ranked? You are confusing...

{{champion:157}}'s playerbase are a bunch of spoiled brats that's for sure. They believe he should have a plethora of viable playstyles and build paths and if you even dare to touch their messiah, they will use their babyrage to rip the very fabric of time to pieces. 

Meanwhile, {{champion:90}}, {{champion:163}}, {{champion:268}}, {{champion:84}}, {{champion:266}}, {{champion:136}}, {{champion:105}}, {{champion:150}}, {{champion:429}}, {{champion:117}}, {{champion:43}}, {{champion:38}}, {{champion:203}}, {{champion:82}}, {{champion:76}}, {{champion:75}}, {{champion:20}}, {{champion:33}}, {{champion:421}}, {{champion:113}}, {{champion:98}}, {{champion:102}}, {{champion:223}}, {{champion:6}}, and {{champion:8}} are all crying in the Corner of Shame with what little they have left in their pathetic lifespans.
To be honest, I am fine playing against Yasuo players. I'm not scared of him anymore. I'm only scared if it is an ally Yasuo or my allies feed Yasuo after having Yasuo 0/3 suddenly turn into 6/3.
blame the player, not the champion.
This I can agree with a lot of times.
Looks like someone watched the Dong Huap video.

Hi there, my name is Dong Huap.

God I love that guy's analogies

Camille is like a whore


Fav one

A lot of the decisions on the champion really make me scratch my head, on why they exist at all or why they exist to the degree which they do.

Why does his Q get a modified unavoidable version when dashing? 
Why does the 3rd stack last so long?
Why does he need a shield, when he has massive mobility, insane auto damage (for lifestealing), and a pseudo block all button?
Why refresh the shield when he ults, at any range?
Why not make his ult channeled?

I don't really consider yasuo to be OP, it's just that all of these are completely unnecessary quality of life decisions that the champion just doesn't really need.
Riot Rationale: His weakness is that he is melee. XDDDDD

I dunno, after the nerfs he's a lot easier to deal with.
Still don't like playing against him, but at least now he's a little better then {{champion:107}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:7}}

Anytime I see him in Ranked I just Auto-lock in {{champion:1}} because like, Hello? Anti-Mobility Queen right there. 

The only real issue pops up when he's on my own team.
actually, i'd play kennen against yasuo because its really easy to play around annie since yasuo's zoning is better than annie's

It's not about Zoning, it's about her Kit countering every aspect of his. 

Her AA range is quite high, allowing her to bully him in lane easily. 
She has 1 projectile in her kit, which is her Q. 
Oddly enough a lot of people don't realize if you don't hit the stun with Q, it doesn't consume it.
If you go to stun with Q and he windwalls it, you keep your stun. 
 
Her W isn't a projectile and neither is tibbers, so it can go through his windwall for easy dueling.

Her E allows her to survive a lot of his dueling potential and his ultimate.
She can survive his burst (Which is where a lot of champions lose against him) to counter burst. 

Tibbers allows her to abuse his naturally low MR.

Okay, wow.
 
AA range does not matter, because it's never a huge difference. In fact, any champ RANGED has high AA range, talk about being redundant. And Yasuo usually fight's ranged champions anyway.

Her Q has quite a lot of damage, which forces you to max AOE on annie, cuz windwall.
Her stun will probably consist of her using E, other wise she is super easy to all in before she has it. Not to mention she has to save the stun to be threatening at all.

>Her W isn't a projectile and neither is tibbers, so it can go through his windwall for easy dueling.

Annie does not duel, and Yasuo is a skirmisher. So if Annie fucks up once, it's an easy kill for Yasuo. Especially with all the downsides of her stun zoning.
She probably wont have E because it would be used to charge the stun, and Yasuo will have PD which gives the same defensive benefits.

Unless you have FULL AS rune page, you'd have over 30 mr as Yasuo. And even then, you would get Maw first item, without losing too much on damage.

You don't understand.

Kennen while being half ranged, has a high damage Q on a low cd, with the benefit OF NOT HAVING MANA, UNLIKE ANNIE. This makes it easy to poke a Yasuo. And before you say "windwall nubb", wind wall has an extremely high CD with it being 18 seconds MAX RANK, and around 30 seconds at rank 1. Annie doesn't have those kinds of specialties Kennen has to poke.

Kennen can stun easily, and since Yasuo is very easy to CC most of the time as kennen, no problemo. Kennen has an ult that can stun a Yasuo in less than 4 seconds at the least, and Kennen can just all in from there while Yasuo is stunned. And well, you can't wind wall when stunned.

And guess what?

Kennen is also ranged.

(not to mention high projectile speed Q, so its hard to wind wall his Q itself)

You really don't play Annie much do you? 
She's not that simple, nor is she that complex.

Annie doesn't "Duel" but she does trade which is basically the same thing unless you want to  nitpick. 
 Her High AA Range makes trading as her very easy, hell AA bullying is literally a tactic that was made popular BECAUSE of Annie in the earlier seasons. 
She has amongst the highest AA range in the game, being amongst the top 5 - 10 highest in the game when champions aren't using AA Modifiers. 
If you seriously think AA Range doesn't matter, it makes me wonder why people hate Caitlyn so much.

In lane charging your stun on minions is 100% recommended.
The only time you SHOULD be using your E to charge your stun is during trades, otherwise it's not really necessary to waste what is her only Defensive spell. 
You can charge your stun for free off of Lane minions. 
The idea of her E being a filler spell is an idea that died in the Mage update.
Her Damage reduction is pure gold in regards to surviving longer in lane.  

I never said you should max AOE on Annie, in fact that's probably the worst thing you could do. 
Just because your W isn't a projectile doesn't mean you HAVE to max it first.
Her Q is still useful, but if it comes down to it your W is a nice fall back if he windwalls your Q stun. 
Even at level 1 Annie's Q is on a 4 second CD, whereas Yasuo's is Windwall is at a minimum 26 second CD.
Given Annie can get into range, she can get off about 3 - 5 Q's in the time his Windwall is down. 

If you SERIOUSLY think Annie ever has Mana problems it's very clear your never play this champion. 
Her Q is refunded when you kills minion, so that's literally free farm.
Even when you don't get it refunded the mana cost is low, and her Mana regen is quite high naturally. 
If necessary you can take some points into the meditation mastery to counter-act it if you're not confident. 

Your W should only be used when trading, and the mana cost doesn't ramp up till you begin maxing it anyways. 

Your E is only a measly 20 mana no matter it's rank. 

Tibbers cost 100 mana, but by level 6 you will have a mana item anyways. 

Before first back it's often just better to farm 900 - 1200 gold so you can get {{item:3802}} or {{item:3010}} 
But even before that it's not entirely necessary to have these items to keep up with Yasuo, just AA bullying him and procing thunderlords with AA - Q - AA is enough to keep up with him early game. 

I can confidentially say Annie is a much better choice into Yasuo then Kennen is.
Her stun is easier to access, she's better for setting up ganks, her burst is almost unmatched, She effectively never falls off and her laning phase is extremely strong. Her stun is longer as well as not being set-up reliant. 

Kennen being able to stun Kennen in less then 4 seconds isn't really anything special when Annie is able to do it almost INSTANTLY with a W or Tibbers. 

Lastly it's funny when you talk about Annie not being able to Zone Yasuo when in fact her Stun is better at zoning then his Whirlwind, as it's permanent, as opposed to his being 10 seconds. 
Once he uses his Whirlwind or runs it down, Annie can use her stun without a care.

He's annoying to play against but honestly the only time I'm pissed off when someone chooses Yasuo is when he's on my team; on the enemy team it usually means a free win. The fact that his player base is awful is a symptom of mechanically more intensive champions. The same can be said for a large number such as Riven, Lee, Vayne etc...

No, but I'm sure people are sick of Yasuo threads by now. 

I think he's the reason most champs that are actually overpowered, stay overpowered. How can Riot know how overpowered champions are if the boards are only crying about Yasuo?


Because we all know they read these balance threads and see expert opinions like Dasdi96's, and instantly think, "Oh, my god. This guy gets it. This guy has such a stellar argument, such a stellar thread, that I think we'll finally nerf Yasuo!" (for no reason)

Well this is a new one.

So...

{{champion:238}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:119}} 

Keep adding champions to the list of toxicity. 

Not like it's actually the player base that is toxic or anything.

Honestly the crying about yasuo bandwagon is pretty much gone..He's not that strong in any elo and he is easily counterable with any sort of cc which is in heavy abundance. You're just beating a dead horse with this post.
I think he's complaining about how unfun he is not how op he is.

There are a ton of champions way more unfun to play against than Yasuo. Annie, Pantheon, Illaoi, Heimerdinger, Caitlyn, actually pretty much any champion that completely changes how you play against them just by existing.
I actually find those champions to be more fun to play against than Yasuo.
He isn't even strong anymore rofl. Every single lethality champion atm outperforms him by a mile.
as a raka player, I have no such feelings for yasuo (I usually end up winning my lane)

> [{quoted}](name=Dasdi96,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gd0dXGXX,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-02-20T15:09:11.306+0000)
>
> {{champion:157}} 
> He is the definition of a spoiled brat. He is a pain to play against as well as to play with. He can hold his q for 10 seconds zoning me from cs, his windwall is still irritating, and his playerbase are notorius for toxicity. He demands all the jungler attention so he can get fed.

I tell u what ill could 1v1 any yasuo at full build with my karma full build and u kno who'll win karma ....
I have a 71% winrate with karma who i main... just fyi...
And no good katma player would lose to yasuo he may try his best to kill me but it would be futile 
In the end yasuo only has tricks ...
If u dont get that ...
Get gub...
